item.title: Series of household waste such as settee, beds and other household waste have been dumped since last week under the tree on Avocet Mews. Your warning notice about prosecution has not deterred these fly tipping criminals. They’ve dumped all these items under the large tree that faces number 28 Avocet Mews Thamesmead London SE28. The tree is also at the bottom of of the garden of number 36 and 37 Harrier Mews and part of the base of the tree falls on Wren Path. This tree is a famous location for fly tippers and I’ve reported countless incidents to you over the years about this tree location being a favourite location for fly tippers. It is so inconsiderate and wicked of residents to do this to other people. Why should I wake up to this mound of waste visible right outside my bedroom window. The council is not doing enough to protect us from these fly tippers. I have asked for cameras to be planted around this tree to catch these criminals but my suggestion has not been heeded. Please kindly investigate and remove these household waste. Than you., 11th January
item.description:
Please see comments above. We cannot continue to live like this. Until the council makes an example of one or all these criminals, this appalling behaviour will continue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avocet Mews, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green wheelie bin abandoned, 11th January
item.description:
Council green wheelie bin has been abandoned by the tree on the corner of Chadwick Road and Lyndhurst Way. Is overflowing with rubbish and is encouraging fly tipping around it. Could it be removed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Chadwick Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These set of brown settees has been dumped on the pavement/grass area on Harrier Mews. This was done under the cover night around 23rd December 2025. It is on your left side of the road as you drive into Harrier Mews from Goldfinch Road. These perpetrators know it is wrong to fly tip waste but they keep doing so under the cover of darkness. It’s not fair nor is it right. Our cul de sac is constantly being blighted with fly tipping of this kind. It’s very depressing to see. Please kindly investigate and remove., 11th January
item.description:
See comments above

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harrier Mews, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, danger to cyclists in dark, 11th January
item.description:
There is a large pothole close to the junction with Sandtoft Road on Eastcombe Avenue. Clearly the area has been patched before but it hasn't worked with all the extra displaced LTN traffic. It is of a size to be dangerous to cyclists and pedestrians particularly in the dark.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastcombe Avenue, Charlton
